content:
The given text discusses particle effect configuration in Panda3D, covering system setup options like particle count and lifespan, renderer settings for visual appearance, and force parameters for realistic movement.

Variation in particle mass.

Average particle terminal velocity.

Variation in terminal velocity.

Some of this information can also be found in the Particle Factories page.

Emitter:

There are a large number of particle emitters, each categorized by the volume of space they represent.

All emitters have three modes: explicit, radiate, and custom. Explicit mode emits the particles in parallel in the same direction. Radiate mode emits particles away from a specific point. Custom mode emits particles with a velocity determined by the particular emitter.

Launch velocity multiplier (all emission modes)

Spread for launch velocity multiplier (all emission modes)

Velocity vector applied to all particles.

All particles launch with this velocity in Explicit mode.

Particles launch away from this point in Radiate mode.

Some of this information can also be found in the Particle Emitters page.
